description: An account was successfully logged on.
notes: Use logon_type filter in Kibana. Type 2=Interactive, 3=Network, 10=RDP. Correlate with source IP for lateral movement. Look for logon_type:3 from suspicious IPs. Check logon_process field for validity.

description: An account failed to log on.
notes: Alert on >10 failures from single source IP in 5min. Status codes: 0xC000006A=bad password, 0xC0000064=no user, 0xC000006E=account restriction, 0xC0000072=account disabled. Monitor sub_status field. Use: failure_code:* | stats count by source_ip,target_user.

description: An account was logged off.
notes: Often unreliable for exact duration tracking as sessions may time out.

description: User initiated logoff.
notes: More reliable than 4634 for interactive sessions.

description: A logon was attempted using explicit credentials.
notes: RunAs command usage. Attackers use this to escalate privileges.

description: Special privileges assigned to new logon.
notes: Indicates Administrator access. 'SeDebugPrivilege' is a red flag.

description: Domain controller attempted to validate credentials (NTLM).
notes: Used for NTLM authentication. Watch for error code C000006A (Bad Password).

description: A Kerberos authentication ticket (TGT) was requested.
notes: First step of Kerberos login. Failure code 0x6 means invalid user.

description: A Kerberos service ticket was requested.
notes: Indicates access to a specific service. Look for '0x0' (Success) or failure codes.

description: Kerberos pre-authentication failed.
notes: Often replaces 4768 failures in newer Windows versions. Critical for detecting bad passwords.

description: A user account was created.
notes: Critical! Verify if this was authorized. Attackers create backdoors this way.

description: A user account was enabled.
notes: Check if a dormant account was suddenly enabled.

description: An attempt was made to change an account's password.
An attempt was made to reset an account's password.
notes: CRITICAL for account takeover detection. Monitor who reset whose password (subject vs target_user). Alert on: non-admin resetting admin/service account passwords, password resets followed by logon attempts (4624) within 5 min. Correlate: 4724 -> 4720 (account creation). Use: event_id:4724 target_user:admin* | stats count by subject_user_name.

description: A user account was disabled.
notes: Standard lifecycle, but suspicious if done to security accounts.

description: A user account was deleted.
notes: Adversaries may delete logs or accounts to hide tracks.

description: A new process has been created.
notes: MUST enable 'Include command line' via GPO (Process Creation). Correlate parent_process_name with process_name. Hunt for: cmd.exe/powershell spawned by unusual parents (Word, Excel, Browser). Use: process_name:powershell.exe parent_process:winword.exe. Critical for malware staging.

description: A scheduled task was created.
notes: HIGH priority for persistence hunting. Extract task_name from XML in event_data. Alert on: SYSTEM/NETWORK SERVICE creating tasks, or tasks running cmd.exe/powershell. Monitor task_content field for suspicious commands. Query: event_id:4698 task_content:*powershell* - Often used for C2 persistence.

description: A scheduled task was deleted.
A scheduled task was enabled.
A scheduled task was disabled.
A scheduled task was updated.
A user's local group membership was enumerated.
notes: Reconnaissance activity. Attackers looking for 'who is admin'.

description: A security-enabled local group membership was enumerated.
A network share object was accessed.
notes: Lateral movement indicator. Source IP is critical here.

description: A network share object was checked for access.
notes: Detailed share logging. Shows exact file path accessed.

description: The audit log was cleared.
notes: IMMEDIATE ALERT. Check who cleared logs (subject_user_name), when (timestamp), and from which host. Correlate with timeline: look for suspicious events BEFORE 1102. This is cover-up activity. Also monitor for 104 (System log clear). Create alert: event_id:(1102 OR 104) | stats count by host,subject_user_name - Attacker TTPs often end with log clearing.

description: The log file was cleared.
notes: Applies to System or Application logs. Suspicious.

description: A new service was installed in the system.
notes: Persistence. PsExec and malware install services to run as System.

description: The service terminated unexpectedly.
notes: Service crash. Could indicate exploit attempt.

description: Timeout reached while waiting for service to connect.
The Event Log service was started.
The Event Log service was stopped.
Engine state is changed from None to Available.
notes: PowerShell session started. Check 'HostApplication' for the command.

description: Provider 'x' is Started.
Module Logging: Pipeline execution.
notes: Logs variable initialization and command invocation.

description: Script Block Logging.
notes: GOLD STANDARD for PowerShell hunting. Extract script_block_text field. Search for: Invoke-WebRequest, New-Object, DownloadString, Reflection.Assembly, IEX. IMPORTANT: 4104 can be huge - aggregate by script_block_text | head 1000. Enable in GPO: Computer > Admin > Event Viewer > Windows Logs > Applications and Services > PowerShell > Operational. Set level=Verbose or Warning.

description: User registered the Task Scheduler task.
User deleted Task Scheduler task.
Task Scheduler executed a task.
Task Scheduler completed a task.
Malware detected.
notes: Defender found something. Immediate investigation needed.

description: Action performed to protect system.
Real-time protection is disabled.
Remote Desktop Services: Session logon succeeded.
Remote Desktop Services: Shell start notification.
notes: Desktop is loading for the user.

description: Remote Desktop Services: Session logoff succeeded.
Remote Desktop Services: Session disconnected.
notes: User closed window but session remains active (cached).

description: Remote Desktop Services: Session reconnection.
notes: User re-attached to an existing session.

description: User authentication succeeded.
notes: Network authentication success. Occurs before session creation.

description: Listener RDP-Tcp received a connection.
Logon hash created.
notes: Created on the SOURCE computer initiating the RDP connection.

description: Process creation.
notes: Includes hashes and command lines. Superior to 4688.

description: Network connection.
notes: Logs every TCP/UDP connection. Very noisy but detailed.

description: Image loaded.
CreateRemoteThread.
notes: Code injection into another process. Malware behavior.

description: FileCreate.
Registry key/value created or deleted.
Registry value modification.
A handle to an object was requested.
An attempt was made to access an object.
notes: Shows actual Read/Write/Delete action on a file/registry key.

description: System audit policy was changed.
WLAN service successfully connected.
WLAN service failed to connect.
User/Device claims information.
notes: Additional information about user context during logon.

description: Group membership information.
notes: Shows groups assigned to the user.

description: A registry value was modified.
notes: Tracks registry changes: created, modified, or deleted values.

description: The handle to an object was closed.
notes: Closes the registry or file access session.

description: A handle to an object was requested with intent to delete.
notes: Precursor to deletion of files or registry keys.

description: An object was deleted.
A handle to an object was requested.
notes: Similar to 4656 - precursor to object access.

description: An operation was performed on an object.
An attempt was made to create a hard link.
Permissions on an object were changed.
A privileged service was called.
An operation was attempted on a privileged object.
A process has exited.
notes: Correlates with 4688 to track process duration and termination.

description: An attempt was made to duplicate a handle to an object.
notes: Process handle duplication - can indicate privilege escalation.

description: Indirect access to an object was requested.
Backup of data protection master key was attempted.
Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.
A primary token was assigned to process.
A service was installed in the system.
notes: Persistence through service installation. Similar to 7045 but from Security log.

description: A token right was adjusted.
A user right was assigned.
notes: Administrative privilege assignment to a user.

description: A user right was removed.
notes: Administrative privilege revoked from a user.

description: A new trust was created to a domain.
A trust to a domain was removed.
Kerberos policy was changed.
Encrypted data recovery policy was changed.
The audit policy (SACL) on an object was changed.
Trusted domain information was modified.
notes: Forest trust or domain trust changes.

description: System security access was granted to an account.
System security access was removed from an account.
notes: Account removed from system-level access rights.

description: A security-enabled global group was created.
A member was added to a security-enabled global group.
notes: User added to domain group - watch for admins added to sensitive groups.

description: A member was removed from a security-enabled global group.
A security-enabled global group was deleted.
A security-enabled local group was created.
A member was added to a security-enabled local group.
A member was removed from a security-enabled local group.
A security-enabled local group was deleted.
A security-enabled local group was changed.
A security-enabled global group was changed.
A user account was changed.
notes: User properties modified (name, email, permissions, etc).

description: Domain Policy was changed.
A user account was locked out.
notes: Account locked due to failed login attempts - watch for brute force attacks.

description: A computer account was created.
A computer account was changed.
A computer account was deleted.
A security-enabled universal group was created.
A security-enabled universal group was changed.
A member was added to a security-enabled universal group.
A member was removed from a security-enabled universal group.
A security-enabled universal group was deleted.
A group's type was changed.
notes: Group scope changed (local to global, etc).

description: SID History was added to an account.
notes: User migration tracking - attacker persistence technique.

description: An attempt to add SID History to an account failed.
A user account was unlocked.
A Kerberos service ticket was renewed.
A Kerberos authentication ticket request failed.
A Kerberos service ticket request failed.
An account was mapped for logon.
notes: Account mapping for certificate or smartcard logon.

description: An account could not be mapped for logon.
The domain controller failed to validate the credentials for an account.
A session was reconnected to a Window Station.
A session was disconnected from a Window Station.
The ACL was set on accounts which are members of administrators groups.
The name of an account was changed.
The password hash an account was accessed.
notes: CRITICAL: Direct password hash access - potential credential dumping.

description: An attempt was made to set the Directory Services Restore Mode administrator password.
The workstation was locked.
The workstation was unlocked.
The screen saver was invoked.
The screen saver was dismissed.
RPC detected an integrity violation while decrypting an incoming message.
Auditing settings on object were changed.
Central Access Policies on the machine have been changed.
NTLM authentication failed because the account was a member of the Protected User group.
Kerberos preauthentication by using DES or RC4 failed.
notes: Weak crypto rejected by Protected User.

description: A user was denied access to Remote Desktop.
A trusted forest information entry was added.
A trusted forest information entry was removed.
A trusted forest information entry was modified.
The following policy was active when the Windows Firewall started.
A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list. A rule was added.
notes: Firewall rule added - may indicate backdoor.

description: A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list. A rule was modified.
A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list. A rule was deleted.
Windows Firewall settings were restored to the default values.
A Windows Firewall setting has changed.
The Windows Firewall Service has started successfully.
The Windows Firewall Service has been stopped.
The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections.
Code integrity determined that the image hash of a file is not valid.
notes: File integrity violation - potential rootkit or compromise.

description: A directory service object was modified.
A directory service object was created.
A directory service object was undeleted.
A directory service object was moved.
notes: AD object moved in directory structure.

description: A directory service object was deleted.
A network share object was added.
A network share object was modified.
A network share object was deleted.
A process changed a file creation time.
Process terminated.
Driver loaded.
RawAccessRead.
notes: Raw disk access - potential malware activity.

description: ProcessAccess.
Registry object added or deleted.
FileCreateStreamHash.
Pipe Created.
Pipe Connected.
WmiEvent (WmiEventFilter activity detected).
WmiEvent (WmiEventConsumer activity detected).
WmiEvent (WmiEventConsumerToFilter activity detected).
DNSEvent (DNS query).
FileBlockExecutable.
FileBlockShredding.
FileExecutableDetected.
The event logging service has shut down.
Audit events have been dropped by the transport.
The security Log is now full.
notes: CRITICAL: Event log at capacity - may stop logging.

description: Event log automatic backup.
The event logging service encountered an error.
Windows is starting up.
Windows is shutting down.
An authentication package has been loaded by the Local Security Authority.
A trusted logon process has been registered with the Local Security Authority.
A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
The system time was changed.
notes: CRITICAL: Time change detected - may indicate covering tracks or timestamp spoofing.

description: A monitored security event pattern has occurred.
Domain Policy was changed.
notes: Alert on any domain policy modification. Monitor for: password policy weakening, lockout policy changes, Kerberos policy changes. Search: event_id:4739 | table user,domain_policy_field,old_value,new_value.

description: A security-enabled global group was deleted.
notes: Monitor for deletion of security groups. Correlate with 4731 (local group delete). Alert if domain admins group deleted.

description: A Kerberos TGT was requested.
notes: Monitor for Kerberos attacks. Look for: failure_code:0x6 (invalid principal), high volume from same source (Golden Ticket attack), service_name changes. Use: event_id:4768 failure_code:* | stats count by client_ip,service_name.

description: A network share object was accessed.
notes: CRITICAL for lateral movement detection. Monitor source_ip, share_name, access_type. Alert on: access to C$, ADMIN$, IPC$. Correlate with logon events (4624). Query: event_id:5140 share_name:(C$ OR ADMIN$ OR IPC$) | stats count by source_ip,target_user_name.

description: A network share object was checked for access.
notes: Detailed share enumeration. Shows file paths accessed. More granular than 5140. Monitor for: reconnaissance activity (many different files from single source), access_mask analysis (0x0001=read, 0x0002=write, 0x0004=append).

description: Network connection established.
notes: VERY NOISY but essential for C2 detection. Monitor: destination_port, destination_ip, protocol. Hunt for: known malware IPs, suspicious ports (8080, 4444, 5555). Aggregate to reduce noise: event_id:3 | stats count by destination_ip | sort - count desc.

description: An IPsec Quick Mode negotiation failed.
notes: IPsec policy violations. May indicate VPN/network policy enforcement issues or tampering.

description: Code integrity check failed.
notes: CRITICAL - Integrity violation detected. File hash mismatch or unsigned driver. Immediate investigation required. Query: event_id:5038 | table host,file_name,file_hash - Potential rootkit indicator.

description: Kerberos pre-authentication failed.
notes: Key event for detecting ASREPRoasting and password spray attacks. Monitor: service_name, status_code, source_ip. Alert on: high failure count from single IP, failures for multiple accounts. Query: event_id:4771 status_code:0x18 | stats count by source_ip,account_name.

description: A Kerberos service ticket was requested.
notes: Detect resource access patterns. Look for: encrypted_ticket_part (0x0=SUCCESS), unusual service_name (check for Kerberoasting). Correlate with process creation (4688) to identify what requested the ticket.

description: Special privileges assigned to new logon.
notes: CRITICAL privilege escalation indicator. Monitor: privilege_list field. Red flags: SeDebugPrivilege, SeLoadDriverPrivilege, SeTcbPrivilege, SeImpersonatePrivilege. Query: event_id:4672 privilege_list:*SeDebug* - Often indicates local privilege escalation.

description: CreateRemoteThread detected.
notes: Process injection attempt (DLL injection, code injection). Immediate alert required. Monitor: target_process, source_process. Hunt for: svchost.exe, lsass.exe, winlogon.exe as targets. Query: event_id:8 target_process_name:lsass.exe | stats count by source_process_name.

description: File created.
notes: Malware dropping files. Monitor: target_filename for suspicious locations (Temp, AppData, System32). Look for: .exe, .dll, .scr, .ps1 in user-writable directories. Heavy filtering needed due to noise.

description: Registry key/value created or deleted.
notes: Persistence mechanism detection. Watch for modifications in: Run keys (HKLM/HKCU\\Run), Services (HKLM\\Services), Browser Helper Objects. Query: event_id:12 registry_key:*Run* | stats count by registry_key_path.

description: Registry value set.
notes: Granular registry modifications. Combined with 12 for full registry monitoring. Heavy noise filtering required - focus on sensitive keys (HKLM\\Security, Run keys).

description: DNS query detected.
notes: C2 communication detection. Monitor: query (domain lookup), query_result (IP resolution). Hunt for: DGA domains, known C2 domains, uncommon TLDs. Query: event_id:22 query_result:* | stats count by query | sort - count desc.
